chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:


Goal:
forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P n \/ ~ P n) -> {n : nat | P n} + {forall n : nat, ~ P n}

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat For S: Argument scope is [nat_scope]
LPO_min : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, P n \/ ~ P n) -> {n : nat | P n /\ (forall i : nat, (i < n)%nat -> ~ P i)} + {forall n : nat, ~ P n}
Classical_Prop.classic : forall P : Prop, P \/ ~ P
nat_ind : forall P : nat -> Prop, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
nat_rec : forall P : nat -> Set, P 0%nat -> (forall n : nat, P n -> P (S n)) -> forall n : nat, P n
Decidable.dec_not_not : forall P : Prop, Decidable.decidable P -> (~ P -> False) -> P
sumor_sind : forall (A : Type) (B : Prop) (P : A + {B} -> SProp), (forall a : A, P (inleft a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inright b)) -> forall s : A + {B}, P s
sumor_ind : forall (A : Type) (B : Prop) (P : A + {B} -> Prop), (forall a : A, P (inleft a)) -> (forall b : B, P (inright b)) -> forall s : A + {B}, P s
list_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Type), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (a :: l)%list) -> forall l : list A, P l
sig_rec : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (P0 : {x : A | P x} -> Set), (forall (x : A) (p : P x), P0 (exist P x p)) -> forall s : {x : A | P x}, P0 s
fast_Zred_factor6 : forall (x : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x + 0)%Z -> P x
RiemannInt_SF.Nzorn : forall I : nat -> Prop, (exists n : nat, I n) -> RiemannInt_SF.Nbound I -> {n : nat | I n /\ (forall i : nat, I i -> (i <= n)%nat)}
fast_Zplus_comm : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (y + x)%Z -> P (x + y)%Z
exist : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) (x : A), P x -> {x : A | P x}
fast_Zred_factor5 : forall (x y : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P y -> P (x * 0 + y)%Z
fast_Zred_factor0 : forall (x : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x * 1)%Z -> P x
fast_Zopp_eq_mult_neg_1 : forall (x : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (x * -1)%Z -> P (- x)%Z
existT : forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) (x : A), P x -> {x : A & P x}
fast_Zplus_assoc_reverse : forall (n m p : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (n + (m + p))%Z -> P (n + m + p)%Z
O_or_S : forall n : nat, {m : nat | S m = n} + {0%nat = n}
fast_OMEGA16 : forall (v c l k : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (v * (c * k) + l * k)%Z -> P ((v * c + l) * k)%Z
RiemannInt_SF.IZN_var : forall z : Z, (0 <= z)%Z -> {n : nat | z = Z.of_nat n}
Z_of_nat_complete_inf : forall x : Z, (0 <= x)%Z -> {n : nat | x = Z.of_nat n}
fast_OMEGA15 : forall (v c1 c2 l1 l2 k2 : Z) (P : Z -> Prop), P (v * (c1 + c2 * k2) + (l1 + l2 * k2))%Z -> P (v * c1 + l1 + (v * c2 + l2) * k2)%Z
Alembert.Alembert_C1 : forall An : nat -> R, (forall n : nat, 0 < An n) -> Rseries.Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rbasic_fun.Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Rseries.Un_cv (fun N : nat => Rfunctions.sum_f_R0 An N) l}
Alembert.Alembert_C3 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Rseries.Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rbasic_fun.Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Rseries.Pser An x l}
Alembert.AlembertC3_step1 : forall (An : nat -> R) (x : R), x <> 0 -> (forall n : nat, An n <> 0) -> Rseries.Un_cv (fun n : nat => Rbasic_fun.Rabs (An (S n) / An n)) 0 -> {l : R | Rseries.Pser An x l}
Inductive sig (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : Type := exist : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A | P x} For sig: Argument A is implicit For exist: Argument A is implicit For sig: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For exist: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ _]
le_not_lt : forall n m : nat, (n <= m)%nat -> ~ (m < n)%nat
not_lt : forall n m : nat, ~ (n < m)%nat -> (n >= m)%nat
Inductive sigT (A : Type) (P : A -> Type) : Type := existT : forall x : A, P x -> {x : A & P x} For sigT: Argument A is implicit For existT: Argument A is implicit For sigT: Argument scopes are [type_scope type_scope] For existT: Argument scopes are [type_scope function_scope _ _]
